aom.scripting.anim

Interface Logic


  • public interface Logic
    This interface lists all possible logics that can be used in an animation script. A typical logic construct using parameters is as follows: 
        ExampleLogic param_1/param_2/.../param_n
    set hotspot
    {
       version
       {
          //do stuff when param_1 applies
       }
    }
    set hotspot
    {
       version
       {
          //do stuff when param_2 applies
       }
    }
    set hotspot {...}
    set hotspot
    {
       version
       {
          //do stuff when param_n applies
       }
    }
    A typical logic construct without parameters is similar to this: 
        ExampleLogic
    set hotspot
    {
       version
       {
          //do stuff when "example" is not true/active/enabled/...
       }
    }
    set hotspot
    {
       version
       {
          //do stuff when "example" is true/active/enabled/...
       }
    }
    Author:
    Mythic_Freak - mythic.freak[a]gmail.com

    • Method Detail

      • WorkedOnLogic

        void WorkedOnLogic()
        Checks whether this unit is worked on. First section: not worked on. Second section: worked on.
        Example
        A buoy is added to fish being gathered from.

      • ContainLogic

        void ContainLogic()
        Checks whether this unit contains another unit. First section: nothing contained. Second section: something (e.g. relic) contained.

      • LastItemLogic

        void LastItemLogic()

      • EmpowerLogic

        void EmpowerLogic()
        Checks whether this unit is being empowered by another unit. First section: not empowered. Second section: empowered.

      • UsedLogic

        void UsedLogic()
        Possible checks whether a specific God Power has been used yet.

      • ItemLogic

        void ItemLogic()

      • CarryTypeLogic

        void CarryTypeLogic(string carry_1,
                    string carry_2,
                    string carry_3,
                    string carry_4,
                    string carry_n)
        Checks whether this unit carries a specific resource. Parameters are separated by slashes. Each section corresponds to 1 of the parameters respectively, in the order they are provided.
        Parameters:
        carry_1 - (e.g. grain)
        carry_2 - (e.g. meat)
        carry_3 - (e.g. fish)
        carry_4 - (e.g. wood)
        carry_n - (e.g. gold)
        Note
        There is no "none" options here. To solve this, an inventory check can be done first to determine whether the unit is effectively holding something.
        See Also:
        InventoryLogic()

      • CinematicLogic

        void CinematicLogic()
        Checks whether the game is in cinematic mode. First section: not in cinematic mode. Second section: in cinematic mode.

      • PowerLogic

        void PowerLogic()
        Possible checks whether a specific God Power is still available.

      • ResourceLogic

        void ResourceLogic(int int_1,
                   int int_2,
                   int int_n)
        Checks whether this unit (e.g. gold mine) has left only a specific percentage of the initial resources. Parameters are separated by spaces. Each section corresponds to 1 of the parameters respectively, in the order they are provided.
        Parameters:
        int_1 - (e.g. 100)
        int_2 - (e.g. 50)
        int_n - (e.g. 25)

      • InventoryLogic

        void InventoryLogic()
        Checks whether this unit has an amount of resource in its inventory. Parameters are separated by spaces. Each section corresponds to 1 of the parameters respectively, in the order they are provided. When checking whether a unit is holding something (e.g. relic, resources), the parameters are: 0 1. When checking how much a herdable has fattened, possible parameters are (for example): 25 75.

      • DamageLogic

        void DamageLogic()
        Checks whether this unit has suffered (more than) a specific percentage of damage. Possible parameters are: 0 25 100.

      • EditorModeLogic

        void EditorModeLogic()
        Checks whether the game is in editor mode. First section: not in editor mode. Second section: in editor mode.

      • SpriteLogic

        void SpriteLogic()
        Checks whether this unit should use sprites. First section: should not use sprites. Second section: should use sprites.

      • FrozenLogic

        void FrozenLogic()
        Checks whether this unit is frozen. First section: unit is not frozen. Second section: unit is frozen.

      • CivilizationLogic

        void CivilizationLogic(string civ_1,
                       string civ_2,
                       string civ_n)
        Checks whether this unit is owned by a specific civilization. Parameters are separated by slashes. Each section corresponds to 1 of the parameters respectively, in the order they are provided.
        Parameters:
        civ_1 - (e.g. zeus)
        civ_2 - (e.g. hades)
        civ_n - More than two civilization can be provided.
        Example
        civilizationLogic none/set determines whether this unit is under Set's control.

      • TechLogic

        void TechLogic(string tech_1,
               string tech_2,
               string tech_n)
        Checks whether a specific technology has been researched yet. Parameters are separated by slashes. Each section corresponds to 1 of the parameters respectively, in the order they are provided.
        Parameters:
        tech_1 - (e.g. none)
        tech_2 - (e.g. plow)
        tech_n - More than two technologies can be provided.

      • UpgradeLogic

        void UpgradeLogic(int int_1,
                  int int_2,
                  int int_n)
        Checks whether this unit is being upgraded to the next stage (i.e. Settlement to Town Center). Parameters are separated by spaces. Each section corresponds to 1 of the parameters respectively, in the order they are provided.
        Parameters:
        int_1 - (e.g. 0)
        int_2 - (e.g. 25)
        int_n - (e.g. 100)

      • ExperienceLogic

        void ExperienceLogic(int int_1,
                     int int_2,
                     int int_n)
        Checks whether this unit has earned a specific percentage of experience. Parameters are separated by spaces. Each section corresponds to 1 of the parameters respectively, in the order they are provided.
        Parameters:
        int_1 - (e.g. 0)
        int_2 - (e.g. 25)
        int_n - (e.g. 100)

      • ConstructionLogic

        void ConstructionLogic(int int_1,
                       int int_2,
                       int int_n)
        Checks whether this unit is in an specific percentage of construction. Parameters are separated by spaces. Each section corresponds to 1 of the parameters respectively, in the order they are provided.
        Parameters:
        int_1 - (e.g. 0)
        int_2 - (e.g. 25)
        int_n - (e.g. 100)

      • AgeLogic

        void AgeLogic()
        Checks whether the player has advanced to a specific age yet.

      • TargetLogic

        void TargetLogic(string unittype_1,
                 string unittype_2,
                 string unittype_n)
        Checks whether this unit is targeting a specific unit type. Parameters are separated by slashes. Each section corresponds to 1 of the parameters respectively, in the order they are provided.
        Parameters:
        unittype_1 - (e.g. none)
        unittype_2 - (e.g. abstractTitan)
        unittype_n - More than two unit types can be provided.
        Example
        Titans attack other Titans in a different fashion compared to regular units.

      • VariationLogic

        void VariationLogic()
        Checks whether this unit is using one of its variations. Each section corresponds to 1 of the possible variations respectively.
        Example
        Male and Female Villagers look differently.

      • CultureLogic

        void CultureLogic(string culture_1,
                  string culture_2,
                  string culture_3,
                  string culture_4)
        Checks whether this unit is owned by a specific culture. Parameters are separated by slashes. Each section corresponds to 1 of the parameters respectively, in the order they are provided.
        Parameters:
        culture_1 - (e.g. Egyptian)
        culture_2 - (e.g. Greek)
        culture_3 - (e.g. Norse)
        culture_4 - (e.g. Atlantean)
